title: The Transparency of Embodied Presence
summary:
This section traces a homecoming from visionary immensity to the lucid ordinary, where awakening is no longer measured by altitude but by intimacy. After years of cosmic exploration and encounters with archetypal radiance, the work curves back toward the simple immediacy of life lived, suggesting that the summit of transcendence is the transparency of experience in time. The touchstone is not escape into dharmakaya but the clearing of perception within the everyday. The classroom becomes the temple: teaching without selves present discloses a field where distinct persons remain distinct, yet their currents mingle as one ocean of mind. The practice offered is radical: remember that what meets in the room are not entities but living streams, and that the shared flow of awareness is primary reality. In this stance, presence becomes diaphanous; walls between hearts thin; the now, ever-vanishing, opens to creative influx. 

Session 66 clarifies the path as purification rather than procurement. The method is focused surrender: locating the knot of psycho-physical discomfort, refusing to bypass, and abiding until it unravels of its own accord, revealing light. One arrives where one began, but without the obscurations that once hid the nature of mind. The transpersonal is not pursued as spectacle; it is the clearance left by the falling away of distortion. Cleansing yields reconciliation: a deep solidarity with men, a healing of inferiority and exclusion into collective triumph, restoring the dignity of brotherhood as service to the whole. This maturation of the interpersonal mirrors the interior purification, as if the subtle toxins of self-image are composted into communal strength. 

Briefly the horizon widens again, not as exile from the human but as its fulfilled trajectory. There is a sensed transition beyond isolation, competition, and conflict into a civilization of mutuality, where communion is the basic medium and participation the basic act. The future is glimpsed as continuity with the present when rendered transparent: the same river, clarified. In this way, diamond luminosity ceases to be elsewhere; it shines through embodied presence. Purity is not sterile perfection but the unobstructed flow of contact, private and shared, equally real. Practice, then, is to remember the living immediacy and to remain with what resists until it opens. In the bookâ€™s arc, this section gathers the cosmic and returns it to the hand, demonstrating that true awakening culminates as clarity within relational life.
